block.p: The New York Yankees could really have let someone else have a turn. After all, they've been the dominant team of the past century. And they nearly did; all five games were close. But when the jumping and hugging and screaming stopped (or have they stopped?), they had again won three straight World Series -- the first such streak since the early 1970's. Even as the glum Mets defiantly vowed ''Next year,'' though, New Yorkers had the true prize: an instantly mythic Subway Series to tell their grandchildren about.
